result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittney A. Woller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant may transfer probation to State of Pennsylvania
Concurrent with: each other

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/full time schooling or combination thereof or at any time she does not meet that condition, she must perform 10 hours of community service per week, UNLESS if involved in inpatient treatment.
Absolute sobriety.  No contact with victims unless as approved by PO.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: with huber for work, treatment, child care, & NA/AA meetings.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any other assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

Court costs paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittney A. Woller

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF497, 15CF631, 15CF702, 17CM45 called: 3:38pm
State appears by ADA K.Puig; Defendant appears in person/in custody with Atty Nick Carroll.

Parties state agreement as to sentence recommendation on all cases.
Defendant makes statement

COURT ORDERS:
15CF497 - Ct. 2>>4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES, w/credit for 229 days of time already served.
15CF631 - Ct. 1>>4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES, w/credit for 256 days of time already served.
15CF631 - Ct. 2>>9 months MCJ w/credit for 9 months of time already served
15CF631 - Ct. 4>>9 months MCJ w/credit for 9 months of time already served
15CF702>> 7 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 4 years ES, w/credit for 523 days of time already served.
17CM45>>9 months MCJ w/credit for 126 days of time already served.
CONDITIONS of ES: Payment of any unpaid CC in cases 15CF497, 15CF631 and 17CF702; Any other assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.

Defendant eligible in all cases to CIP and SAP.

COURT ORDERS in 17CM45-unpaid CC are converted to CV judgment

Adj: 3:56pm

Re:  SAR
Matter placed on calendar call 6/29/17 at 1 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF423, 15CF497, 15CF631, 15CF632, 15CF648, 15CF702,15CM665, 15CM752, 15CM818 called: 8:19am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Sharon Gisselman.
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
15CF423>>D&RI entire file
15CF497 - Ct. 1>>D&RI

15CF632 - Ct. 1>>D&RI

15CM665>>D&RI entire file
15CM752>>D&RI entire file
15CM818>>D&RI entire file
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
15CF497 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF631 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>GUILTY
15CF631 - Ct. 2 (Credit Card Fraud)>>GUILTY
15CF631 - Ct. 4 (Credit Card Fraud)>>GUILTY
15CF632 - Ct. 2 (Credit Card Fraud)>>GUILTY
15CF702 - Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine)>>GUILTY



COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on all counts; Probation as follows>>6 years on 15CF702; 3 years on Felony BJ charges; 1 year on Credit Card Fraud charges; ALL concurrent
CONDITIONS: Absolute sobriety; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C w/victimes unless as approved by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or at any time she does not meet that condition, she must perform 10 hours of C.S. per week, UNLESS if involved in inpatient treatment; CC; DNA sample and surcharge (surcharge on all counts); in 15CF702 Ct. 1 ONLY -- 1 year MCJ w/huber for work/treatment/child care; Credit for time served as follows>>15CF497-35 days; 15CF631-62 days on each count; 15CF632-74 days; 15CF702-62 days (which may be applied to conditional time).

>>Defendant may transfer probation to the State of Pennsylvania.
